cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi SW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast across the Florida Panhandle and Southeast U.S., then turning east-northeast and moving offshore of the North Carolina coast toward the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Mid-Atlantic; tropical storm watch limited to Gulf coast earlier advisories
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL; Storm Surge Warning: Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, south-central Georgia, South and North Carolina coasts, outer banks, then the western Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast winds 25–35 mph possible Monday as the post-tropical remnant passes offshore, well below tropical-storm strength likelihood
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware Bay / South Jersey shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain (1–2 inches) possible late Sunday night into Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the southern New Jersey coast during Monday
